Maximum file size: No directory hierarchy (but accessibility of files depends on user areas via USER command since CP/M 2.2)

Maximum volume size[d]: Not limited. Approx. 800KB (one side) for 90 min cassette

Maximum pathname length: ? No limit defined (workaround for OS limit)
32,760 Unicode characters with each path component no more than 255 characters[7]

Allowable characters in directory entrie: ASCII (0x00 and 0xFF not allowed in first character)
SFN: OEM A-Z, 0-9, ! # $ % & ' ( ) - @ ^ _ ` { } ~, 0x80-0xFF, 0x20. LFN: Unicode except NUL, " * / : < > ? \ | [c][e]
SFN: OEM A-Z, 0-9, ! # $ % & ' ( ) - @ ^ _ ` { } ~, 0x80-0xFF, 0x20. LFN: Unicode except NUL, " * / : < > ? \ | [c][i][e]
SFN: OEM A-Z, 0-9, ! # $ % & ' ( ) - @ ^ _ ` { } ~, 0x80-0xFF, 0x20. LFN: Unicode except NUL, " * / : < > ? \ | [c][i][e]
Maximum pathname length: 32,760 Unicode characters with each path component no more than 255 characters[7]

Allowable characters in directory entrie: In Win32 namespace: any UTF-16 code unit (case-insensitive) except /\:*"?<>| as well as NUL In POSIX namespace: any UTF-16 code unit (case-sensitive) except / as well as NUL[12]
Maximum pathname length: 32,767 Unicode characters with each path component (directory or filename) up to 255 characters long[f]
32,767 Unicode characters with each path component (directory or filename) up to 255 characters long[13]

Maximum filename length: 14 or 30 bytes, set at filesystem creation time
14 or 30 bytes, set at filesystem creation time

Maximum file size: Available cache space at time of write (depends on platform)
